node.title: Stephen Colbert tests positive for COVID-19
node.description: New episodes of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" are set to return on May 2.
node.content: ["Television host Stephen Colbert has tested positive for COVID-19, he announced Thursday. \"The Late Show with Stephen Colbert\" only on CBS has been cancelled for Thursday night. \u00a0", "\"Yep! I tested positive for Covid, but basically I'm feeling fine- grateful to be vaxxed and boosted,\" Colbert wrote on Twitter. \"Thank you for the well wishes.\"", "Thursday's show was scheduled to feature \"Ozark\" stars Jason Bateman and Laura Linney.\u00a0", "\"This just proves that I will do anything to avoid interviewing Jason Bateman,\" Colbert said.\u00a0", "Have a question you want to ask #Ozark stars @batemanjason and Laura Linney? Tweet it at us with the hashtag #OzarkLSSC and they may answer it! #LSSC pic.twitter.com/8YzxmWBiXQ", "The show will air repeated episodes from Friday through next week as previously planned, according to the \"Late Show\" Twitter account. New episodes are set to return on May 2.\u00a0", "Tori B. Powell is a breaking news reporter at CBS News. Reach her at tori.powell@viacomcbs.com"]
